alert.note: Alert for Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 04 at 11:54PM CDT until May 05 at 4:45AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR OKMULGEE COUNTY... The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Okmulgee County in northeastern Oklahoma... * Until 445 AM CDT. * At 1154 PM CDT, Emergency management reported dangerous flash flooding is ongoing across central and northern Okmulgee county. Home evacuations are ongoing in the city of Okmulgee. Between 2 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Okmulgee County. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Okmulgee... Morris... Beggs... Schulter... Preston... Bald Hill... Okmulgee State Park... Liberty... Hectorville... Eram... FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CATASTROPHIC
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
